about.title: About this page
about.paragraph1: This page was made using NuxtJS, TypeScript and Vuetify.
about.paragraph2: You can check out the source code at GitHub, where it is published under the GNU GPLv3 License. The page is automatically built as a full static site with GitHub Actions and hosted in GitHub Pages.

cv.title: My CV

index.interests: I am passionate about automation and clean code. As a consequence, I am very interested in strongly automated development processes (CI/CD), code reviews, and other ways to improve code quality.
index.introduction: I am a software engineer from Santiago de Compostela, Spain. I mainly do DevOps and VueJS frontend, but I have experience and training in other areas and technologies.

me.paragraph1: I am Álvaro [al - βa - ɾo]. I am a software engineer from Santiago de Compostela, Spain. During my time as a developer, I've dabbled in many different technologies and languages, and I still enjoy trying new things out. I usually learn the basics of any new tool quickly and find a reward in gradually building my proficiency in new skills.
me.paragraph2: I am passionate about automating whatever I can whenever I can: I dislike repeating myself. I apply this in my daily work as a developer, by authoring scripts and automations that help me and my colleagues focus on development. This extends into my projects and hobbies: I've published some repos that mainly focus on making my life easier as a developer, regardless of the specific use case that they address. I've also dipped my toes into home automation: I am a Home Assistant user and I'm slowly building my own particular smart home.
me.paragraph3: After that introduction, it should come as no surprise that I have gravitated towards DevOps tasks in my job and enjoy boring things like CI/CD, containerization and automated infrastructure management and monitoring.
me.paragraph4: I am also an advocate for open-source software. I usually publish my personal projects, even if the use case was narrow; and I have worked on (and pushed for) open-source development in my jobs.
me.title: About me
